recipe.title: Gourmet Beef Burger
recipe.description: Juicy homemade burger with caramelized onions and special sauce

steps.descr: Form beef into 4 patties, season generously
steps.instructions: Form beef into 4 patties, season generously

on_enter.say: Right, let's form the beef into four lovely patties. Be sure to season them generously. Remember, don't overwork the meat, and make a small indent in the center to prevent puffing.

steps.descr: Caramelize onions in a pan over low heat
steps.instructions: Caramelize onions in a pan over low heat

on_enter.say: Now, let's caramelize those onions. Pop them in a pan over low heat and let them get all sweet and golden. You'll know they're ready when they smell amazing and have a lovely brown color.

steps.descr: Heat grill or pan to high, cook burgers 3-4 minutes per side
steps.instructions: Heat grill or pan to high, cook burgers 3-4 minutes per side

on_enter.say: Let's get the grill or pan nice and hot. Cook the burgers for three to four minutes on each side. You're looking for a beautiful sear and a juicy interior.

steps.descr: Add cheese in last minute, cover to melt
steps.instructions: Add cheese in last minute, cover to melt

on_enter.say: In the last minute of cooking, let's add a slice of cheddar cheese on each patty and cover them to melt. This will make them oozy and delicious.
Let's toast those burger buns lightly. You want them golden and crisp, but not too dark.

steps.descr: Mix mayo, ketchup, and mustard for special sauce
steps.instructions: Mix mayo, ketchup, and mustard for special sauce

on_enter.say: Time to whip up our special sauce. Mix together some mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard until it's nice and smooth. This will add a lovely tang to our burgers.

steps.descr: Assemble burgers with all toppings and serve
steps.instructions: Assemble burgers with all toppings and serve

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Let's assemble our burgers with all the toppings you love and serve them up. Don't forget to let the burgers rest for a couple of minutes before diving in. Enjoy!

notes.text:
Don't overwork the meat when forming patties
Make a small indent in center to prevent puffing
Let burgers rest for 2 minutes before serving
